intro: Kunzea affinis, commonly known as the narrow-leaved kunzea, is a shrub native to the coastal regions of southern Australia. It belongs to the Myrtaceae family, which includes eucalypts and tea trees, and is characterized by its aromatic foliage. The plant typically grows to a height of 1–3 meters and features narrow, lance-shaped leaves with a silvery underside. It produces small, white or pinkish flowers in clusters, which attract nectar-feeding birds and insects. Kunzea affinis is well adapted to coastal environments, tolerating salt spray and sandy soils.
